title: Vicksburg Ms Police public records request

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Good day.
 I hope you are doing well. 
I am requesting the following records from your agency. 
Can you please provide a list of officers currently employed by the police department by name and rank.
 Also, by District. 
Drug crimes possession of all illegal drugs. 
I want a list of the suspects'  drugs charges and the officer who made the arrest.
 I want crime data on this crime from the years 2022-2025.
 Also, a list of the most frequent crimes your community faces.
 
Let me know if you have any questions or concerns. 

I look forward to hearing from you. 
Thank you for your time and consideration. 
Take care and be well.
 

Best regards,
 Cameron Oliver
 904-489-9118
 oliverkidsjax@gmail.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cameron John Oliver

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: CA CVR Data Request (2022, 2024) (Los Angeles County Registrar-Recorder/County Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast generated by the relevant voting system technology in Los Angeles County in that year. In case it is helpful reference, Alameda County has an example of these records posted for the 2024 General Election on their Election Information for November 2024 under the name “Cast Vote Records (CVR) Report”. 

Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: Jeremy Newcome THP (Safety.openrecords@tn.gov)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting a public records request under the Tennessee Open Records Act (T.C.A. § 10-7-503) to obtain information regarding the employment status of Jeremy Newcome with the Tennessee Highway Patrol.
Specifically, I am requesting:
Confirmation of whether Jeremy Newcome is currently employed by the Tennessee Highway Patrol.
If Jeremy Newcome is no longer employed, the date of termination and any publicly available records related to the reason for termination.
Any other releasable records concerning Jeremy Newcome’s employment history with the Tennessee Highway Patrol.

Please provide the requested records in electronic format to hughesclues1@gmail.com

If any portion of this request is exempt from disclosure, please provide a written explanation citing the specific legal exemption and release any non-exempt portions of the records.
If there are any fees associated with processing this request, please notify me in advance. 
I can be reached at hughesclues1@gmail.com if you have any questions or need clarification.

Thank you for your assistance in processing this request. 
I look forward to your response within seven business days, as required by T.C.A. § 10-7-503(a)(2)(B).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with HughesClues.

title: Long Beach PD: Erika Limon documents

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Long Beach PD: Erika Limon documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Respectfully, this is a request to the Long Beach Police Department for the full missing person investigation file for a missing juvenile named Erika Limon who was reported missing from Long Beach on July 22nd of 1999. 

For guidance here is an active page regarding Ms. Limon: 

https://oag.ca.gov/missing/person/erika-limon-0

Ms. Limon appears to be alive and well and active on social media. In 2014 an email address I operated repeatedly sent messages regarding this Erika Limon account, the replies to which implied that the case was no longer active and that Ms. Limon had been located alive and well in Mexico.  

Please include any correspondence, either to or from, with NCIC, CJIS, the California DOJ, NCMEC, the U.S. Department of State, or any other local, state or federal law enforcement or government agencies regarding the disappearance of Erika Limon. 

If there are portions of these documents (including anything that could be considered a "case file" or "case documents" or a "case narrative") that cannot be released due to this being an active investigation, then please:

Provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

If this is a closed investigation then please release the applicable case files. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

For guidance here are relevant case numbers:

Long Beach PD Case #: 99-0055192 (or 990055192)
NCIC Case #: M700033494
NCMEC Case #: 868002

Thank you for the Long Beach Police Department's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working together in having this request resolved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: PRA Request :: P018228-051225
communications.communication:
Dear Robert Delaware: Thank you for your interest in public records of the Long Beach Police Department. Your request has been received and will be processed in the order it was received. Your request was received in this office on 5/12/2025 and given the reference number P018228-051225 for tracking purposes. The Public Records (PRA) division does NOT process Police Reports, Arrest Reports or Subpoenas. These requests must be submitted to the Information Management (IM) division: https://www.longbeach.gov/police/how-do-i/request-a-police-report/ The IM division report request helpline is (562) 570-7381. If your PRA requests such records, it will be closed upon receipt. Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist. If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt (Ca. Civ. Code, § 10.). 
 
 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Long Beach Police Department Request Center.

title: Request for Bodycam Footage – Arrest of Jessica Stahl on 06/16/2022

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Request for Bodycam Footage – Arrest of Jessica Stahl on 06/16/2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the body-worn camera footage of the officers who arrested Jessica Stahl. She was taken into custody by the Parker Police Department on June 16, 2022, after fatally striking a pedestrian—25-year-old Lacy Lewis—while allegedly under the influence of heroin and other substances. After initially stopping, Stahl asked if she had hit someone but failed to call 911 or render aid, remaining in her car for nearly six minutes. She later fled when approached by officers, leading them on a short high-speed chase before being stopped. Following her arrest, she was found to have extensive heroin use and had a young child in the vehicle during the incident. Stahl was later convicted on multiple felony charges, including vehicular homicide. I am requesting the available body-worn camera footage from officers who interacted with Stahl during the investigation, traffic stop, pursuit, arrest, and any DUI testing procedures.

Suspect’s Name:
Jessica Stahl

Type of Crime:
Vehicular Homicide (DUI), Child Abuse, Leaving the Scene of an Accident, DUI with Bodily Injury

Date of the Arrest:
06/16/2022

Time of the Arrest:
Shortly after 2:00 AM

Location of the Arrest:
Intersection of Parker Road and Cottonwood Drive, Parker, CO


Arresting Agency:
Parker Police Department, Douglas County, CO

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Request for Bodycam Footage – Arrest of Jessica Stahl on 06/16/2022
communications.communication:
Good morning,

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the body-worn camera footage of the officers who arrested Angelina Washburn. She was taken into custody by the Trinidad Police Department on or around December 9, 2023, after officers responded to a call about a vehicle reportedly striking a person on a bicycle. title: Request for Bodycam Footage – Arrest of Robert Medlock on 01/16/2023

communications.subject: Indiana Access to Public Records Act Request: Request for Bodycam Footage – Arrest of Robert Medlock on 01/16/2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Indiana Access to Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting the body-worn camera footage of the officers who arrested Robert Medlock. He was taken into custody by the Evansville Police Department on January 16, 2023, following a violent encounter near Fourth Avenue and Georgia Street. According to reports, Medlock was stopped while riding a bicycle after running a stop sign. He displayed signs of drug possession, resisted arrest, and attempted to flee. A prolonged struggle followed, including multiple deployments of a Conducted Electrical Weapon (CEW), during which Medlock allegedly struck an officer in the face. After escaping, he armed himself with an axe and barricaded himself in a garage. Officers eventually removed him and placed him in handcuffs. I am requesting the available body-worn camera footage from all officers who engaged with Medlock during the stop, struggle, pursuit, and final arrest.

Suspect’s Name:
Robert Medlock

Type of Crime:
Battery on Law Enforcement, Resisting Arrest, Possession of Methamphetamine, Obstruction, Burglary

Date of the Arrest:
01/16/2023

Time of the Arrest:
Approximately 4:25 PM

Location of the Arrest:
Intersection of Fourth Ave & Georgia St, Evansville, IN (and nearby detached garage at 1100 block of Georgia St)

Arresting Agency:
Evansville Police Department (Vanderburgh County)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Christopher Udeani

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Shooting Targets (Texas Department of Public Safety)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records related to the purchase and use of targets used for marksmanship training:

Targets are defined as paper and metal targets used by the department for shooting lethal and nonlethal weapons (40mm foam rounds, tasers, etc). They can be stationary or moving. 

Purchase and invoice records for targets
Scans, photos, website links, and any record that shows what the targets look like

Search 2018 to today’s date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Payment Due: C397537-051225
communications.communication:
RE:  Public Records Request#: C397537-051225 
 
Dear Joey Scott, 
 
 PAYMENT DUE 
 
The City may be the custodian of at least some of the requested public records and a payment is due to continue processing this request. Please log into the Portland Public Records Request Center to pay these fees. 
 
Fees include research time to locate and analyze the requested records, even if no records are located or if the requested records are determined to be exempt from disclosure. We will not be working on your request until we receive the payment. 
 
Please log in to the Portland Public Records Request Center (copy and right click this link to open it in your browser) and make a payment on this request.
 
You may pay by electronic check or credit card by going to "My Records Request Center" and select "View My Invoices." Then scroll to find your open invoice and select "Make Payment." Follow the screen prompts to make a payment. 
 
Mailing a check could delay the response time and it is preferable that you use the online payment portal to make an electronic payment. However, if you need to mail a check, please reply to this message and ask for the correct address. Please be sure and provide your Reference Number (C397537-051225) on your check.

Thank you for your interest in the public records of the Austin Police Department. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 5/12/2025 and given the reference number R157725-051225 for tracking purposes.

Austin Police Department

title: 1995 and 1997 Recommendations of Removal Under 8 U.S.C. § 1227(a)(4)(C) (U.S. Department of State)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 1995 and 1997 Recommendations of Removal Under 8 U.S.C. § 1227(a)(4)(C) (U.S. Department of State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the following recommendations referenced in a May 9, 2025, filing by the U.S. Department of Justice in Khalil v. Joyce, et al., Civ. Act. No. 25-1963 (MEF) (MAH) (D.N.J.), available at https://storage.courtlistener.com/recap/gov.uscourts.njd.564334/gov.uscourts.njd.564334.246.0.pdf:

(a) by Secretary of State Warren Christopher to the Attorney General on January 5, 1995, that Mohammad J.A. Khalifah ("Khalifah") be removed under INA § 241(a)(4)(C) (the "Khalifah Recommendation");
(b) by Secretary of State Warren Christopher to the Attorney General on March 29, 1995, that a Haitian national (the "Haitian National") be removed under INA § 241(a)(4)(C) (the "Haitian National Recommendation");
(c) by Secretary of State Warren Christopher to the Attorney General on October 2, 1995, that Mario Ruiz Massieu ("Massieu") be removed under INA § 241 (a)(4)(C) (the "Massieu Recommendation"); and
(d) by Secretary of State Madeleine Albright to the Attorney General on April 4, 1995, that a Palestinian national ("the "Palestinian National") be removed under INA § 241 (a)(4)(C) (the "Palestinian National Recommendation").

2. Any communications between the Department of State, the Department of Justice, and/or the Department of Homeland Security concerning any of:
(a) Khalifah or the Khalifah Recommendation;
(b) the Haitian National or the Haitian National Recommendation;
(c) Massieu or the Massieu Recommendation; or
(d) the Palestinian National or the Palestinian National Recommendation. 

3. Any internal communications, reports, or other records referencing any of:
(a) Khalifah or the Khalifah Recommendation;
(b) the Haitian National or the Haitian National Recommendation;
(c) Massieu or the Massieu Recommendation; or
(d) the Palestinian National or the Palestinian National Recommendation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Request Acknowledgement by DOJ-EOIR PAL
communications.communication:
Dear Adam  Steinbaugh, 

This response acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request by the Executive Office for Immigration Review (EOIR).  Your request has been assigned control number 2025-60857. 

Please be advised that the status of requests submitted through the Public Access Link (PAL) may be tracked at https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx, and you will receive an email response to your request upon completion of processing. The status of requests submitted by email or mail may not be trackable through the PAL, but you will still receive an email or mailed response to your request upon completion of processing. (https://foia.eoir.justice.gov/app/Home.aspx) Please ensure the email address you provided in PAL will be able to receive the messages we send you. Messages rejected by your email account will not be rerouted to you. 
Please be aware that EOIR is a component of the Department of Justice and the custodian of records for the “Record of Proceedings” (ROP), which is the compilation of documents and digital audio recordings produced in proceedings before the immigration courts and the BIA. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is the custodian of records for the “A-file,” which is a series of records of a person’s immigration history and is maintained and stored by DHS. EOIR is not the custodian of records for DHS or its components, nor does EOIR have access to DHS’s A-files. EOIR does not create an ROP until matters are initiated by DHS. Nevertheless, EOIR may create and maintain ROPs for proceedings other than removal proceedings (i.e., credible fear reviews, bond hearings). You may request a copy of your Notice to Appear (NTA) and full A-file from DHS. (https://www.dhs.gov/foia) 
Note that parties to immigration cases (including respondents and their representatives of record) have the option to request their Record of Proceedings directly from the immigration court or Board of Immigration Appeals. Please see the instructions here: https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest. (https://www.justice.gov/eoir/ROPrequest) 

If you have filed a fee waiver request, EOIR will address the fee waiver in a separate letter. Most requests for records of proceedings do not require any fees; however, if the fees for processing the request are estimated to exceed $25.00, EOIR will notify you before processing the request to determine whether you will commit to paying the fee or whether you wish to narrow the scope of your request to reduce the fee. Fees may be charged for searching records at the rate of $4.75 (administrative)/$10.00 (professional) per quarter hour, and for duplication of copies at the rate of $.05 per copy. The first 100 copies and two hours of search time are not charged, and charges must exceed $25.00 before we will charge a fee. 

The FOIA requires an agency to respond within 20 working days after receipt of the request, and EOIR endeavors to meet this standard.  The FOIA permits a ten-day extension of this time period, pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B), based on unusual circumstances.  Your request involves “unusual circumstances,” and EOIR is extending the time period to respond by an additional 10 working days because your request requires the collection of records from field offices, or involves a search, collection, and review of voluminous records, or requires consultation with another agency or two or more agency components. 

EOIR FOIA requests are placed in one of three tracks. Track one is for those requests that seek and receive expedited processing pursuant to subsection (a)(6)(E) of the FOIA. Track two is for simple requests that do not involve voluminous records or lengthy consultations with other entities.  Track three is for complex requests that involve voluminous records and for which lengthy or numerous consultations are required, or those requests that may involve sensitive records.  As a matter of default, your request has been placed in track two for simple requests.  If you have requested expedited processing, EOIR will contact you in a separate letter. 

If you have any questions regarding unusual circumstances, you may contact the EOIR FOIA Service Center or FOIA Public Liaison at EOIR.FOIArequests@usdoj.gov to discuss reformulation or an alternative time frame to process your request, or for any further assistance regarding any aspect of your request. Alternatively, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer.  The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, Room 2510, 8601 Adelphi Road, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001; e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at (202) 741-5770; toll free at (877) 684-6448; or facsimile at (202) 741-5769. 
 
Sincerely, 

FOIA Intake

(b) by Secretary of State Warren Christopher to the Attorney General on March 29, 1995, that a Haitian national (the "Haitian National") be removed under INA § 241(a)(4)(C) (the "Haitian National Recommendation");
(c) by Secretary of State Warren Christopher to the Attorney General on October 2, 1995, that Mario Ruiz Massieu ("Massieu") be removed under INA § 241 (a)(4)(C) (the "Massieu Recommendation"); and
(d) by Secretary of State Madeleine Albright to the Attorney General on April 4, 1995, that a Palestinian national ("the "Palestinian National") be removed under INA § 241 (a)(4)(C) (the "Palestinian National Recommendation").

2. Any communications between the Department of State, the Department of Justice, and/or the Department of Homeland Security concerning any of:
(a) Khalifah or the Khalifah Recommendation;
(b) the Haitian National or the Haitian National Recommendation;
(c) Massieu or the Massieu Recommendation; or
(d) the Palestinian National or the Palestinian National Recommendation. 

3. Any internal communications, reports, or other records referencing any of:
(a) Khalifah or the Khalifah Recommendation;
(b) the Haitian National or the Haitian National Recommendation;
(c) Massieu or the Massieu Recommendation; or
(d) the Palestinian National or the Palestinian National Recommendation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Pentagon Academic Libraries Committee

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Pentagon Academic Libraries Committee
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any document sufficient to show the members of the Academic Libraries Committee referenced in the May 9, 2025, memorandum entitled "Reviewing the Department's Military Educational Institution Library Collections," issued by Timothy D. Dill, and available at https://media.defense.gov/2025/May/09/2003707607/-1/-1/1/REVIEWING-THE-DEPARTMENTS-MILITARY-EDUCATIONAL-INSTITUTION-LIBRARY-COLLECTIONS.PDF.

2. Any communication sent to any member of the Academic Libraries Committee (in their capacity as a member of the Committee) referencing "13950". 

3. Any "criteria and procedures" recommended by the Academic Libraries Committee as referenced in the memorandum dated May 9, 2025.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, instant messages, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication. "Communications" also includes transcripts, videos, audio, minutes, notes, or other recordings of conversations, meetings, phone calls, or Zoom (or similar) meetings.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 32 CFR § 286.8(e)(1)(i)(B) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and press freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social). The Department has previously granted expedited processing to my requests. See, for example, FOID 25-F-2201 (Appeal No. 25-A-2201-A1).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the Department's creation of an "Academic Libraries Committee" to determine what educational or academic materials are to be removed from Department institutions.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a news story of public interest. That issue has attracted a wide range of news media coverage, including the numerous articles identified below. The information has value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis because it concerns the Secretary's implementation of a presidential policy priority, and because the information sought will contribute to the public's ability to provide feedback as the Department implements that policy priority. If that information is only disclosed months or years later, it will inhibit the ability of the public to understand how its officials are currently making decisions.

Examples of recent articles demonstrating the public's ongoing and current interest in this information include these articles:

https://apnews.com/article/pentagon-hegseth-dei-library-books-770364ab99591402ddffe8758432ff26
https://www.stripes.com/theaters/us/2025-05-09/pentagon-dei-academies-library-books-17741389.html
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/05/09/us/politics/pentagon-hegseth-dei-library-books.html
https://www.cbsnews.com/news/pentagon-orders-military-leaders-to-pull-library-materials-dei/
https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/may/10/pentagon-dei-gender-ideology-books
https://www.upi.com/Top_News/US/2025/05/10/Pentagon-orders-military-libraries-remove-books-diversity-racism-gender-issues/1041746897357/
https://www.cnn.com/2025/05/09/politics/pentagon-military-academies-review-books
https://thehill.com/policy/defense/5293254-pentagon-orders-swift-review-removal-of-library-books-that-address-diversity-anti-racism/
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/11/us/politics/naval-academy-banned-books.html
https://www.cbsnews.com/news/dei-purge-holocaust-book-maya-angelou-memoir-pulled-from-naval-academy-library/
https://www.washingtonpost.com/education/2025/04/02/naval-academy-remove-400-dei-books/

Additionally, the Department itself issued a press release concerning the memo and the Committee, reflecting the Department's recognition that there is a public interest in timely information about it: https://www.defense.gov/News/Releases/Release/Article/4180537.

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 32 CFR § 286.12(l), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to the policies, procedures, and practices of senior Department officials concerning the Department's policies and programs.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations, as the information pertains to the policies and underlying information driving decisions by senior Department officials. That information is not in the public domain.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Records Request – University of Oregon Disclosure of ADA Records to Grand River Solutions

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Records Request – University of Oregon Disclosure of ADA Records to Grand River Solutions
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to Oregon Public Records Law, I respectfully request access to records related to the disclosure of employee disability- or accommodation-related information to third-party vendor Grand River Solutions by the University of Oregon.

This request is submitted in the public interest and relates to the potential unauthorized sharing of sensitive medical and ADA-related records concerning a civil rights complaint, during a period of protected activity under the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and ORS 659A.

Specifically, I am requesting:

1. Contracts and Agreements
All contracts, MOUs, scopes of work, or other service agreements between the University of Oregon and Grand River Solutions executed or in effect from January 1, 2024 to present.

2. Disclosure Authorizations
Any records, approvals, or internal communications authorizing the disclosure of employee disability, accommodation, or civil rights complaint information to Grand River Solutions, including but not limited to any records referencing:

 * “Kelvin Shivers II” or “Kelvin Shivers” or “Kelvin" 

3. Internal Legal or Risk Review
Any communications between OICRC, HR, General Counsel, or external consultants regarding the legality, advisability, or risk of disclosing employee medical or accommodation-related records to Grand River Solutions.

4. Communications With Grand River Solutions
All emails or written communications between any University of Oregon employee and any representative of Grand River Solutions from January 1, 2025 to present that reference:

   * “Kelvin Shivers II” or “Kelvin Shivers” or “Kelvin"
   * “ADA” or “accommodation”
   * “civil rights complaint” or “retaliation” 

5. Policies or Training Materials
All institutional policies, training materials, or written guidance regarding the sharing of employee ADA, accommodation, or medical information with third-party consultants or investigators, in effect from January 1, 2024 to present.

6. Redacted Copy of Shared Record
If permissible, a redacted copy of any employee-related records provided to Grand River Solutions that reference Kelvin Shivers II, with personally identifying medical information removed to the extent required by law.

I am also formally requesting that the University of Oregon preserve all records related to my ADA accommodation requests, disability disclosures, civil rights complaints, and any internal or external communications referencing me or these matters.
